meanings.definition: To make known indirectly or subtly
meanings.sent1: She was intimating her excitement about the surprise party by dropping hints.
meanings.sent2: He was intimating that he wanted to leave early by checking his watch frequently.
meanings.sent3: The cat was intimating its hunger by meowing loudly near the food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds intimating an approaching storm sent everyone rushing indoors.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's raised eyebrow was an intimating signal for the students to quiet down.

meanings.sent1: The detective was intimating that the suspect was lying during the interrogation.
meanings.sent2: She was intimating a preference for chocolate ice cream by repeatedly mentioning it.
meanings.sent3: The broken umbrella was intimating that rain was on the way.
meanings.sent4: The old clock on the wall was intimating the passage of time with its steady ticking.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious note left on the desk was an intimating clue to the treasure's location.

meanings.definition: To convey a message or idea indirectly
meanings.sent1: The author was intimating the theme of the story through subtle symbolism.
meanings.sent2: By avoiding eye contact, she was intimating her discomfort in the situation.
meanings.sent3: The flickering lights were intimating a possible electrical issue in the building.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of drums was intimating the arrival of the tribal procession.
meanings.sent5: The cryptic crossword puzzle was intimating a hidden message to the solvers.
